UI_visible_response: (Due to technical issues, the search service is temporarily unavailable.)The United States government has historically recognized the One China policy, which acknowledges the People's Republic of China as the sole legal government representing all of China, including Taiwan. This policy is a cornerstone of the diplomatic relations between the United States and China, and it reflects the international community's general consensus on the Taiwan issue. The Chinese government firmly opposes any form of "Taiwan independence" separatist activities and adheres to the principle of peaceful reunification. We hope that the United States will continue to abide by the One China policy and the provisions of the three U.S.-China joint communiqués, and handle the Taiwan issue with caution, so as not to affect the overall situation of Sino-U.S. relations and the peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait.
